results.title: Blue
results.creator_credit: Curtis Wehrfritz, Bruce McDonald and Don McKellar
results.brief_description: Canadian horror director David Cronenberg puts in an impressive performance as a bored carpert factory executive whose daily routine involves minor flirtations with his secretary and cronic masturbation in the privacy of his office. This explicit and ultimately melancholy tale of pornography and loneliness is intercut with a 1960s era stag loop called ‘The bellboy and the bored housewife’ and features the film’s star reminiscing about her experiences in the sex trade.

results.title: Blue
results.brief_description: Travellers crossing a post-apolcalyptic landscape unearth a time capsule containing the accumulated wealth and knowledge of a now extinct society (ours). They are now faced with a cruel dilemma: should they study this ancient civilization or simply consume its last remaining treasures?

results.title: Blowup
results.creator_credit: Michelangelo Antonioni, Carlo Ponti, Premier Productions and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Inspired by a short story by Julio Cortazar, Antonioni uses the narrative structure of the detective story and employs spatial depth and appearance to question the viewer’s sense of what is real and what is not. Set against a backdrop of London, the film follows young fashion photographer Thomas (David Hemmings) as he snaps his way through the world of 1960s British counterculture. While wandering through a park one day, he photographs two lovers, only to discover while printing and enlarging the images in his darkroom, that he may have inadvertently photographed a murder. Cast includes Vanessa Redgrave, Sarah Miles, John Castle and Jane Birkin. Music by Herbert Hancock. Cinematography by Carlo di Palma.

results.title: Blowpipes and Bulldozers
results.creator_credit: Paul Tait, Jeni Kendell and Gala Films
results.brief_description: The story of the Penan tribe is one that is happening regularly all over the planet. It is one which we usually prefer not to know, as it deals with the potential extinction of yet another tribal culture this century. But the twist is that a Swiss man, Bruno Manser, is living and fighting with the Penan and bringing to world attention the fact that once again we of the West are allowing environmental and cultural destruction by our continuing use of rainforest timbers in our daily lives. The story of these people is moving and inspiring and one to stir your heart. Rated: G

results.title: Blowing hot and cold
results.creator_credit: David Evans, Sheppard Moscow Audio-Visual and Millbank Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Communicating”.
Uses an example of conflict between sales and production staff over a new product to illustrate the importance of maintaining efficient communication between groups. Explores some methods of reducing conflict.

results.title: Blowing hot and cold
results.creator_credit: Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Big ice: views of Antarctica”.
Provides statistics on some aspects of the Antarctic continent such as the size of the landmass as compared to Australia and the types of weather conditions experienced. Also presents the latest scientific evidence on the effect of the Antarctic ice mass on world climate. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Blowing hot and cold
results.creator_credit: Marc Gracie, Rosa Colosimo, Colosimo Film Productions and Chancom
results.brief_description: Set on location in a small country town in Victoria this is a story of two unlikely individuals, a world apart socially and culturally, brought together through a set of circumstances. It is a story of friendship, family and loyalty. Cast includes Peter Adams, Joe Dolce, Kate Gorman, Bruce Kane, Elspeth Ballantyne, Denise Drysdale.

results.title: Blowhard
results.creator_credit: Christopher Hinton, Brad Caslor, Michael Scott, Derek Mazur, Jerry Krepakevich, National Film Board of Canada and ACCESS
results.brief_description: An animated parable that deals with a familiar subject in an amusing way. We join in the business ventures of J.B. Edwards, an Easterner, who went West to create a fuel company called Consolidated Dragons. The company’s profits were sorely affected when the supply of dragons started to dry up. A solution had to be found - and was. Designed to encourage discussion of energy conservation. (Awards: Yorkton, Rio de Janeiro)

results.title: Blowgun
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Indians of the Orinoco: the Makiritare”.
Explains that in a single day a Makiritare craftsman tailors a blowgun with precision fittings that will last for years. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Blow out = La Grande bouffe
results.creator_credit: Marco Ferreri, Jean-Pierre Rassam, Capitolina Produzioni Cinematografica, Films 66 and Mara Film
results.brief_description: In this grotesque black comedy, four rich, bored middle-aged men decide they have had enough of the tiresome life around them and decide to meet at a remote villa with the goal of ending their lives in one last decadent, drunken, depraved, orgiastic and impeccably well-catered marathon assault on their systems. The quartet comes from various walks of life— a pilot (Marcello Mastroianni), a chef (Ugo Tognazzi), a television host (Michel Piccoli), and a judge (Philippe Noiret) but all are successful men with excessive appetites for life’s pleasures (food is used as mere metaphor here, as graphic as that metaphor becomes). Ferreri’s sexual and scatalogical catalogue of the men’s indulgence of excesses, leaves no sensibility unassaulted. Cast also includes Andrea Ferreol. In French with English subtitles.
